sentences.english: If you need money, I'll be your factory of money .
sentences.chinese: 如果你需要金錢，我願做你的鑄幣廠。

sentences.english: The medals will go into production later this year at Royal Mint's headquarters in Llantrisant, South Wales.
sentences.chinese: 今年晚些時候，皇家鑄幣局就將開始製作獎牌。

sentences.english: That is where seigniorage comes in.
sentences.chinese: 鑄幣稅就在這裏發揮作用。

sentences.english: The coins bore a bust of their emperor and the date of minting.
sentences.chinese: 硬幣上常刻有其國王半身像和鑄幣日期。

sentences.english: During that year, the U. S. mint released four new pennies.
sentences.chinese: 在那一年，美國鑄幣廠發行四個新便士幣。

sentences.english: They learned to mint from the Greeks.
sentences.chinese: 他們從希臘人那裏學會鑄幣。

sentences.english: The Mint takes pride in the educational value of many of its commemorative coins.
sentences.chinese: 鑄幣廠發生在其紀念幣很多教育價值的驕傲。

sentences.english: Chapter 3 analyses the economic effect and welfare effect ofseigniorage.
sentences.chinese: 第三章分析了鑄幣稅的經濟效應和福利效應。
它們由私人鑄幣廠製造出來。

sentences.english: They all minted coins and had their own standards for weights and measures.
sentences.chinese: 他們都鑄幣幣有自己的標準和度量衡。

sentences.english: About this time, the mint employed forty-four women.
sentences.chinese: 這期間，鑄幣廠僱傭了44名女工。

sentences.english: Seigniorage is a convenient source of revenue for some governments.
sentences.chinese: 鑄幣稅是一些政府機構的便捷的財政收入來源。

sentences.english: The opposite, "cost of carry", is not regarded as a form of seignorage.
sentences.chinese: 相反，“運載的成本”並不能視爲一種鑄幣稅。

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 自強運動|自强运动
official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
